intro: Noccaea eigii, commonly known as the alpine penny-cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Noccaea eigii is adapted to cold climates and is typically found at high altitudes.
